text: Tim Follin seems to have a habit of making awesome themes to horrible games, you should all check out the Puzznic theme.
author: Tyler Hubbs

text: Classic Follin. Gotta love those arps
author: Nick Roselin Oleksiak

text: Part of it sounds like the music from the Crash Dummies Game Boy game.
author: GameBeatenakaKevinS

text: The High Score theme is even better!
author: Zenju

text: Damn, this sounds like it came straight from a Keygen. Kudos!
author: lamsorz

text: If only Tim Follins had been hired by a more competent video game company..
author: TheOchitsuke

text:
Software Creations has made some good games like Solstice and Plok, but they made some really bad ones too, their licensed games were usually terrible, with a few exceptions like Spider-Man and Venom: Maximum Carnage and Ken Griffey Jr. Presents Major League Baseball.

At least you could always count on the Follin bros to deliver an amazing soundtrack though.
author: Brie Russell

text: I'm surprised you didn't pick the "High Score" music theme from this game. It's easily more dynamic and memorable.
author: Medal Melodies

text: ティムフォリン節炸裂！　まさに職人の技ですな～
author: 懐かしのゲーム音楽

text: This theme by Tim Follin was easily the best thing about this game. Probably the worst basketball game I played, I still remember the big Pepsi ad right in the middle of the court. Because of that, I used to call it the Pepsi basketball game.
author: SupraDarky

text: Tim Follin is a genius when it comes to making music on limited hardware.  One of my personal favorite composers on limited hardware.  The stuff he could do is absolutely mind blowing.
author: Eric C.

text: @Eric C. And his soundtrack for Gauntlet 3 on the C64, fantastic. His brother Geoff was amazing too; I still listen to the C64 music for Sly Spy Secret Agent with awe.
author: batlin

text: Talent wasted on a crappy game again :<
author: Mr. Fuzzums
